headband is designed to be quick project that is done over the weekend perfect for using the yarn stash that you already have at home it is ideal for wearing in the transition period when the mornings are cold and the days are much warmer to protect your ears and forehead from the cold floral headband is knitted flat in stockinette stitch then floral motifs are embroidered the sides are joined together and finally the headband is sewn on top sizes adjustable for all head circumferences includes written instructions for sizes from 2-year-old to adult sizes head circumferences 48 50 52 54 56 58 60 cm 19 00 19 75 20 50 21 25 22 00 22 75 23 50 in all measurements are approximate centimetres are rounded to the nearest 0 5 cm and inches to the nearest 0 25 needles 5 0 mm us 8 circular needles or single point needles or any size to obtain gauge gauge 17 sts x 22 row = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 in using 5mm us 8 in stockinette stitch after blocking yarn sport weight yarn 100 % alpaca held with lace weight silk-mohair yarn 75% mohair 25% silk shown examples are knitted with filcolana alpaca 167m/50gr 183 yd/1 76 oz in colours light blush 334 and slightly purple 369 held together with drops kid-silk 212m/25gr 232 yd/0 88 oz in colour light pink 03 embroidery thread anchor tapestry wool or any other knitting yarn with clear twist and that is not too stretchy shown examples are embroidered in colours 8522 8582 and 9072 yarn requirements 75 75 75 75 100 100 100 m 82 82 82 82 109 109 109 yd embroidery thread requirements 5 m 5 5 yd of each colour you will also need embroidery backing for motif transfer and embroidery sharp needle with large eye tapestry needle scissors frixion pilot pen written instructions cast on 28 32 36 40 42 44 46 stitches using the long-tail cast-on method work flat back and forth in stockinette stitch knit on the right side purl on the wrong side for 95 99 103 109 113 117 121 row or until headband measures 43 45 47 49 51 53 55 cm bind off from the right side in knit leaving the tail long enough approx 150 cm for the mattress stitch 2 embroidery once you have done knitting you can start embroidering first you need to transfer the motif to the
